title: Authorizes optometrists to prescribe certain drugs that may be used for therapeutic purposes and taken orally
summary: Authorizes optometrists certified to use therapeutic pharmaceutical agents for the treatment or prevention of ocular disease, to also use specified oral pharmaceutical agents in their practices; requires completion of a 25 hour phase three therapeutic pharmaceutical agent certification course of didactic education; permits the commissioner of health to recommend other categories of drugs that may also be prescribed.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to the practice of optometry
